text:
The door opened a crack. Two sharp eyes stared out. 

Raskolnikov lost his head. He pulled the door toward him. 

“Let me in,” he thought. 

Alyona Ivanovna clutched the handle. He nearly dragged her out. 

“Good evening, Alyona Ivanovna,” he stammered. 

His voice shook. “I have come… I brought something…” 

He stepped inside the room. 

“Good heavens! Who is it? What do you want?” she exclaimed.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confronts the old woman, Alyona Ivanovna, in a tense and suspicious encounter as he enters her room uninvited.
